docs.lead_paragraph: CHILDREN need space. Not nearly enough is being said about this, Cornelia Goldsmith has been telling us. She points out that children need space to move freely, to run and jump, swing and slide and climb, and she finds reason to be concerned about the effect on young children of crowded apartments and family doubling up.

headline.main: Room to Play and Move About

docs.abstract: Theory on needlessly painful childbirth noted
